Solicitation Title: Purchase of a DC-8 Replacement Aircraft
Description Text:
NASA’s Science Mission Directorate (SMD) Airborne Sciences Program (ASP) is conducting market research, for planning purposes only, regarding interested small businesses, preferably small disadvantaged businesses, who are capable of providing a replacement to the NASA DC-8 aircraft.  Vendors may provide information related to multiple aircraft to include:


	Boeing 767 series
	Boeing 777 series
	Airbus A330 series


Responses must provide the following information:

     1) Company name, mailing address, and point of contact (name, telephone number and e-mail address).

     2) Company’s size standard based on NAICS Code 336411.  Small business concerns are defined as 1500 employees or less. 

     3) For each aircraft identified by the vendor, provide the following:

          a. Make and model of the aircraft, to include a full report and aircraft logs (tail number, age of aircraft, flying status, flight hours, landings, dates of last inspection, dates of next inspection, location, etc.)

          b. Engine status and history.  Are engines leased or owned by the current operator?  If leased, what motors will be included with delivery of aircraft?

          c. Damage history to the aircraft.

          d. Summary of required ground support equipment, to include any aircraft specific or unique support equipment.

          e. Current airworthiness status.

          f. Aircraft specifications, to include any aircraft modifications.

          g. Photographs of the aircraft.

          h. Estimated price of the aircraft.

           i.  Any other additional data related to the aircraft to assist the Government in developing the requirement for planning purposes.

    4) Offeror’s capability to fully complete all necessary FAA paperwork to register and transfer aircraft to NASA.

The Government does not intend to award a contract on the basis of this RFI or to otherwise pay for the solicited information.  This RFI is for planning purposes only and shall not be considered as a request for proposal or as an obligation on the part of the Government to acquire any products or services.  The provided information may be utilized by the Government in developing the requirement.  Any proprietary information that is submitted may be used in establishing the requirement but specific information labeled as Confidential will be safeguarded as proprietary. 

Potential respondents to the RFI shall submit a “Notification of intent to submit a response to the RFI” to the below identified Points of Contact (POCs).  The notification shall identify the respondent’s contact information.  Upon receipt of a notification of intent to submit, the respondent will receive a link for response submittal.

POCs:


	Angela Stinchfield, Contracting Officer, at angela.t.stinchfield@nasa.gov
	James Williams, Contracting Officer, at james.g.williams-1@nasa.gov


Responses must be submitted no later than 2:00 PM Pacific Time, 12 April 2022.

Solicitation Title: AIDEWS  Traveling Wave Tube (TWT) LRUs Engineering Services
Description Text:
This requirement is for repair, modernization, engineering services, and CLS support. The estimated period of performance (PoP) is a five-year contract (basic plus four option years) and will continue through FY27.

The Government’s needs for services are required in order to support the Foreign Military Sales (FMS) defensive system currently deployed on US allied military’s F-16, Boeing 737, and Boeing 777 platforms. AIDEWS is a modular electronic warfare system that can be designed to provide integrated radar warning and radio frequency countermeasures and advanced stand-along radar notifications. The major components included in this effort are:


	Traveling Wave Tube (TWT)
	LRU-4
	LRU-6


Please see attached Performance Work Statement (PWS) for additional performance requirements.

The major components included in this effort are:

2. LRU-4

Please see attached Performance Work Statement (PWS) for additional performance requirements.

Solicitation Title: Boeing 777 Air Frame and Boeing 747 Sections
Boeing 777 Air Frame and Boeing 747 Sections
Description Text:
____________________________________________________________________3-23-2018 Amendment 2: 1. Provide government response to industry question (Q14/A14)2. Includes REVISION 1 of ATTACHMENT I - PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS paragraph D.(6) All other terms and conditions remain unchanged.____________________________________________________________________3-23-2018 Amendment 1: Government response to question from industry as of 3-19-2018, (see attached) Vendors are required to sign and return 1 copy of the SF30 with their proposal.____________________________________________________________________This is a solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with FAR Part 12, Acquisition of Commercial Items, FAR Part 13.5, Simplified Procedures for Certain Commercial Items and as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This solicitation will utilize simplified procedures for soliciting competition, evaluation, award documentation and notification that comply with FAR 13.1. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; quotes are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued. 
This solicitation is issued as a request for quotation (RFQ). The solicitation number is W91ZLK-18-T-0017. It is the Government's intent to award a firm-fixed-price purchase order. This requirement is set-aside 100% for small businesses, BRAND NAME ONLY, Firm Fixed Price contract; all qualified Contractors are encouraged to submit a quote. It is the contractor's responsibility to be familiar with the applicable clauses and provisions. The clauses may be accessed in full text at these addresses https://acquisition.gov/far/index.html and http://www.acq.osd.mil/dpap/sitemap.html. The NAICS code is 336411, with a small business size of 1,500 employees.
The Army Contracting Command - Aberdeen Proving Ground (ACC-APG) on behalf of the US Army Aberdeen Test Center (ATC) is seeking Contractors to provide one (1) Boeing 777-(any subclass) airframe and four (4) Boeing 747-(any subclass) fuselage sectional pieces in accordance with attached specifications and requirements (Attachment I). Please see Attachment I - Specifications and Requirements for additional details. Contractor shall complete and return Attachment II - RFQ Worksheet, Attachment III - Past Performance of at least 3 projects within the last four years if available, and Attachment IV - FAR 52.213-3 ALT I, along with their quote. The Contractor shall specify delivery and break-down timeline estimates after receipt of order, unit prices, extended prices and commercial warranties with quote submissions. Quotes shall specifically address each requirement identified in Attachment I. Partial quotes will NOT be evaluated by the Government. All equipment WITHOUT EXCEPTION must be in accordance with specifications presented in Attachment I, and any manufacturer's warranty information must be included. All submissions must be BAA Compliant and clearly annotated on the quotation.
Delivery and Installation will be made FOB Destination to:
Aberdeen Test CenterPhillips AirfieldAberdeen Proving Ground, Maryland 21005
Award will be made on the basis of the lowest evaluated price of proposals meeting or exceeding the acceptability standards for non-cost factors in accordance with FAR 15.101-2. The non-cost factors are the technical requirements, in accordance with Attachment I, Attachment III - past performance, and delivery date. The order will be awarded to the Lowest Price Technically Acceptable (LPTA) offeror. The technical evaluation will be a determination based upon information provided by the Contractor. The Government is not responsible for locating or securing any information which is not identified in the offer. The Government reserves the right to make award without discussions.
Quotations and Attachments must be dated and received by US Army Contracting Command, Aberdeen Proving Ground, Tenant Division, Technologies Branch 6001 Combat Drive, 2nd Floor, Room C2-101, Aberdeen Proving Ground, MD, 21005-1846, Attention Mr. Raphael, Contracting Specialist, via email at: Solomon.a.raphael.civ@mail.mil NLT Friday, 06 April 2018 at 11:00 AM ET. Late submissions will not be evaluated. All quotations from responsible sources will be fully considered. Contractors who are not registered in the System for Award Management (SAM) database prior to award will not be considered. Contractors may register with SAM by calling 1-866-606-8220 or online at https://www.sam.gov or through the Federal Service Desk at http://www.FSD.gov.
QUESTIONS: For questions concerning this Request for Quotation contact Mr. Raphael via email at: Solomon.a.raphael.civ@mail.mil. Please provide any questions NLT Friday, 23 March 2018 at 11:00 AM ET. NO TELEPHONE REQUESTS WILL BE HONORED.
